post.body: The availability of unlimited SMS plans in the US is the reason for that trend. Well that and services like Twitter, Facebook.
I have to believe both locked and unlocked N97s will be available, depending on whether or not you want the operator subsidy.
you have awesome clients, but you knew that. ;)
when you figure out friendfeed, let me know. ;)
Mrs @phoneboy (she'd hate to be called that) doesn't waste her time with Twitter, Facebook, Jaiku, or anything like that.
I agree with you, but of course I still drink the Nokia cool-aid. :)
I'm up for at LEAST two more hours. :)
I guess you don't call it being stuck in HEL for nothing, right? LOL
Both :)
the iPod Touch might make an interesting pocket computer.
Truphone won't receive calls on the touch, right? No background apps.
Based on past experience, if the phone ships in Q2 2009, it's unlikely you're getting a production N97 at Christmas. Beta, maybe.
I can't speak for all of the RUI restaurants, but I like Kincaids, Clinkerdagger, and Stanley and Seaforts, so... :)
I want to SEE TOWERS so I know my damn phone will work!
@danyork I'd be signing up to lease my land to the carriers, if I had any usable land. Put all the damn towers up you want!
@danyork They really need to normalize the laws for towers and such across the country. This is NATIONAL INFRASTRUCTURE.
They also own Stanley and Seaforts in Tacoma. http://www.r-u-i.com/
I'm starting to dig the predictive text on the E71.
Sucks about the keyboard on the Peek. It totally makes or breaks a QWERTY device. It's one thing I absolutely love about the E71.
I expect a report on the Peek. :) I assume the display unit was a dummy.
Well that price has been invalid for a month now on that Peek. I'll have to check mine the next time I go.
People are deperssed, so they're boozing it up. Sounds typical if you ask me.
I imagine it wasn't an extravagant party, but it's still nice to go out on the company dime once in a while.
I bet it's also not at the Target stores either. I like to play with a device before I buy it.
Basically, the basic cable we have costs $5, as Comcast charges an extra $10 if you don't have Cable TV.
makes you wonder whether their box actually performs to spec.
AT&T has to use both 850 and 1900. They don't own 1900 in all markets.
I didn't see them at our local Costco. Are they at the phone kiosk or somewhere else?
Dave and Busters is cool. Wish I were in the Bay Area so I could go!
We could all do with that kind of bread.
So what does @thurrott have to say about this second Red Ring of Death you've experienced?
Why aren't you using the built-in podcasting application on the E71 like I do?
In the years I lived in Santa Cruz, I don't think I did the holiday lights train. How was it?
Wordmobi still needs an offline function, otherwise it's not that useful for me.
Not yet, wife's still at the vet.
no, vets aren't cheap, especially once you go outside business hours.
there is nothing wrong with charred animal flesh. It is the way nature intended.
good to see the freeing of GPS. I'm not a fan of handsets that come from carriers because of lost/restricted functionality,
One of my friends on Jaiku drunk Jaikus, then goes back later and delete the threads. They are sometimes quite embarrassing.
I wish operators here in the states would consider dropping all subsidized handsets too.
Kids are expensive. I don't even want to think about what college will cost for my kids when they eventually go there.
regardless, it shouldn't be. FCC or FTC complaint time.
isn't telemarketing to your mobile illegal?
I've actually gotten pretty good at not answering my landline when Caller ID isn't someone I know. Do you still have a landline?
you'd think they'd know what services you have. They bill you for them, don't they?
People do respect copyright, but all it takes is one person to not have respect for it. No wonder RIAA was on the warpath.
I don't get spam from AT&T. Probably because I don't live in AT&T's landline footprint and someone else pays my mobile phone bill. :)
too bad T-Mobile doesn't have quite the coverage (or 3G) that AT&T does. T-Mobile does have far better customer care, though.
AT&T always trying for the upsell.
@donthorson SuperDuper & ext. 2.5" drive FTW!
My question is: where is Tweetdeck for my Nokia S60 device? :)
Download! could easily be an App Store as well, one not tied to carriers and premium SMS as it is now.
@jamesbody here's an idea for you: http://ping.fm/9mMPU
are you troubleshooting customer service or something?
it's not a disturbance of the force, it is a metaphysical certitude that rants will occur.
step away from the keyboard and take a nap! :)
I couldn't live without the Podcasting app.
cheap phone cards FTW! It's how I refill my wife's T-Moble prepaid
I used to live in Spokane, I know what the snow there is like. Crazy you've got any because we've had an amazingly dry fall.
Moi? Play with words? Nah.... must have mistaken me for someone else....
I need some writing inspiration, too. :)
you and your poking.
I was talking about a customer and it seemed like the best word to use. While I do Knowledge Management, this wasn't it.
You have to be careful what you say on the official forums.
I wish I got a raise. In these challenging times, I'm just happy to have a job!
I was more trying to get a sense of areas, since I see the ads. I know you don't serve Gig Harbor because CenturyTel is our LEC.
An explanation of metaphysical certitude is here: http://is.gd/aU8b
I have Crossover Mac, so I can try it there. But that's not the point. I want to see it natively in Mac OS X!
Value is in the eye of the beholder. I do my share of "good morning" posts, but I also do a lot of others.
where you been?
What about those of us who have over 6000? :)
It still boils down to the motivation for wanting to grow your social network. Mine is simple: shameless self-promotion. :)
I think that's a better question for a COMPANY, not an INDIVIDUAL. It depends on what your goal is with social media.
You should see some of the emails my boss gets for recruiting candidates. It's downright scary.
great post! I hear from teachers that they are hampered by a lot of unfunded mandates and potential parental lawsuits.
if I could get FiOS, I go for that. For right now, Cable wins.
because I CAN! :)
Starbucks isn't the best quality over here, though it is by far the most consistent. And it has AT&T/T-Mobile/Boingo WiFi. FTW!
The same as they pay me for working out of my house. I just occasionally need a change of scenery. And coffee someone else makes.
I obviously didn't notice when it disappeared. :)
I miss going to lunch with you guys, too. Wish we had a customer over there that I could pretend needed visiting. LOL
Tedly is a smart dude.
that's why I always vote against the incumbent. Politicians are like diapers--they need to be changed frequently.
@you2gov I would expect most of our politicians to ignore social networks. Most of them don't get it.
Dare I ask what the PRD is about? :)
Clint Eastwood is right, America has turned into a bunch of soft, crybabies.
you are a rockstar!
Contracts on getting @guykawasaki to do a Unified Communications section for Alltop!
I am more willing to try something that someone I know recommends. But then again, as a smart social media guy, you know this.
your crap software plus our corporate laptop image is a recipe for an epic fail. :)
will give dabr.co.uk a try on your suggestion. No time yet today. :)
most Jaiku threads last a day at the most. They have value, but their utility is limited.
why is dabr.co.uk better than m.slandr.net?
Jaiku does not do private messaging.
@cybette I wish someone would write a tweetdeck for S60 or even J2ME. Twibble is getting close, but it's not there yet.
You can have conversations on Twitter as well, though it requires more work. Twitter is simplistic, but ultimately more flexible.
it is insanely cold, at least for this part of the world. Yes, to my friends in Spokane and Ottawa, you can stop laughing now,
I'd like to make it back to that part of the world, even if there's 5 feet of snow! We'll see after the Check Point acquisition.
I will likely make it to 10 years in Nokia, but beyond that, too early to say.
It's just a matter of not driving too fast.
I'd be happy to work for/with @cschick and @jussipekka, but open job reqs are hard to come by right now.
Given the deal Nokia just signed with Check Point about our business unit, don't know how much longer I'll be a Nokia employee.
Spinrite may still be able to make the drive usable again or tell you that SMART says the drive is about to epicly fail. :)
it is rare for sure, but my driveway is epicly long! I hope I will be able to move in the morning.
after spending 6 hours shoveling out my driveway with the 6 inches of snow on it, I could do with far LESS white. :)
good luck getting home!
if you have a failed disk, you need Spinrite in order to recover it. It is truly an epic tool!
Alright, y'all, I'm up past my bedtime. Made a dent in my work inbox at least, am behind everywhere else. G'nite!
Resetting up ping.fm via IM on GTalk.
Welcome to dinner time. Like Miller Time, but without the beer.
Thinking too much about work, the global recession, and the future. Off to dream of better days.
Not feeling motivated.
Giving Tweetdeck a restart before I walk away from the computer until the kids go to bed.
Gas at Gig Harbor Costco: $1.65. No complaints here.
Finances top concern as economic crisis continues. No shit, Fox News,
Y/Costco time.
Turns out there was nothing wrong with the cat, at least that they could find. False alarms involving animals aren't cheap.
Wife called, said it's going to be a while before they know anything about the cat. He's being ornery for the vet, moreso than usual.
Came home to cat barf. Not usually a bad thing except when it's mostly blood. Wife is rushing the cat to the vet to make sure he's ok.
done visiting the six foot rat. Lots of tokens for next time.
you'd think the six foot rat would want as many people to visit him as possible. The parking situation completely discourages it.
About to pick up kids from photographers and take them to the evil, six foot rat place.
I think that's the last of the yardwork until Spring.
burning out the last of the gas in my lawnmower and weed whacker.
Booting up my corporate VMware image to change the password and apply all the security patches for the last few months.
Thinking about all the work I need to do. The typical holiday slowdown hasn't kicked in yet, and taking days off isn't helping.
just talked to a repairman at Comcast. DOCSIS 3.0 is now in the local plant. Explains the major outage last night and IP address change.
Christmas lights are up at home, at the Y on the stationary bike.
Happy Monday. On tap for today: Christmas Lights. If the weather holds.
OpenDNS deployed, Comcast still down, and I'm up past my bedtime again. G'night!
Comcast is currently down in my area. This is exactly why I have a DSL line as well.
Help me understand why Truphone on an iPod Touch is exciting: http://ping.fm/xPX87
Hi @CZ hope it's not too late!
going to the Y before my next con call
Happy hump day! Looks like some mid-afternoon meetings are going to force an early or late workout today.
Ok, NOW I am going to bed. Really. Honestly.
Think I just put in a half a day of work between the time the kids were in bed and now.
Love that @theeraldvorak and @leolaporte are fawning over the Nokia E71 on TWiT 172.
Having a code monkey moment: http://ping.fm/TYmqP
Good News arrives from an unexpected source. Sounds a bit like a fortune cookie, I know, but today, it's the truth.
To Whom It May Concern: My email has become a black hole. Your emails are important to me and will be actioned in the order received.
Playing with Google Chrome 1.0. Where's the flippin Mac version already?
Welcome @actiontec friend of @kencamp and @sherylbreuker, fan of at least some of your products. :)
Trying out SlickIM.
Ok, AT&T kicked me off *AGAIN* after 2 hours when I'm on the corporate VPN and using Boingo. *grumble*
There is something right about my daughter listening to Sesame Street Sings The Alphabet. It's what I listened to growing up!
At the Y. Sauna time.
RT: Whatleydude: If you're at #twinterval and using m.twitter.. STOP! Sign into http://dabr.co.uk at once! SO much better! X
watched Iron Man. Not exactly what I was expecting, but not bad.
Follow david worley
+1 to this: RT @atmasphere: Mauku for S60 or my desktop system or both would be so killer
RT @andrewsmhay: What The A-Team Can Teach Us About Information Security http://www.andrewhay.ca/archives/590
realizing that I forgot to wish my Jewish friends Happy Hanukkah! Will have a lot more of them when I become a Check Point employee.
Awake. Very very sore from yesterday's shoveling efforts.
Bedtime. I'm bushed!
6 hours later and my driveway is shoveled enough to drive it. The soreness, it is EPIC.
the end of the shoveling is near. Will need major drugs after I'm done.
still working on shoveling the driveway. I am making progress. Might even finish before dark!
